sense.name: a burial chamber, usually underground
sense.examples: Bob's grandfather is buried in the family vault. The king was buried in a vault beneath the cathedral.

sense.name: a secure storage room for valuables
sense.examples: The president of the bank knows the combination to the vault. They keep the furs in a vault for cold storage during the summer.

sense.name: arched ceiling or roof of a building
sense.examples: This church has a famous fresco painted on its vault. We looked up at the vault of capitol building. The poem described the blue vault of heaven. (figurative extension)

sense.name: act of jumping over an obstacle
sense.examples: The athlete's vault over the 7-foot bar was astounding. John's older brother showed him how to fall from a vault.

sense.name: roof of a body cavity
sense.examples: The brain surgeon made a small hole in the cranial vault to relieve the pressure.
